notes: The story was part of the Key to Time arc.
Robert Holmes wrote the story due to the incompletion of 'Shield of Zarak'.
John Leeson, the voice of K9, played Dugeen.
The story had to feature the biggest monster in the show.

in_universe_mythology: The Doctor and Romana seek the fifth segment of the Key to Time.
The Swampies plan to awaken their god Kroll.
real_world_cultural_references: The Doctor implies he learnt his singing technique from Dame Nellie Melba.
The tune the Doctor plays is by J.S. Bach.
items: Segment of the Key to Time

continuity_notes: Part of the Key to Time season.
K9 is marooned in the TARDIS due to unsuitable terrain.

plot.plot_summary: The Fourth Doctor and Romana I arrive on Delta III's marsh moon in search of the fifth segment of the Key to Time. They become embroiled in the conflict between the Swampies and the refinery crew. The Swampies intend to awaken Kroll, a giant creature the Doctor believes has been magnified by the Key segment. After thwarting Thawn's plan to destroy both Kroll and the Swampies, the Doctor retrieves the segment, shrinking Kroll back to normal size.
